response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 1½ tsp baking powder, 1 tsp baking soda, and ½ tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl, beat 1 cup sugar and ½ cup butter until light and fluffy. Add 2 eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each. Stir in 1 tsp vanilla extract and ½ cup milk, blending until smooth.",
  "step3": "Combine the dry ingredients with the wet mixture, alternating with ½ cup buttermilk. Mix until just combined; avoid over‑mixing. Fold in ½ cup chocolate chips for extra texture and flavor.",
  "step4": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Tap pans gently to release air bubbles. Bake 25–30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks.",
  "step5": "Whip 1 cup powdered sugar with 2 tbsp milk and 1 tsp vanilla until smooth. Spread a thin layer over the first cake layer, place the second layer on top, and cover the entire cake with the remaining frosting. Decorate with chocolate shavings if desired.",
  "step6": "Refrigerate the finished cake for 30 minutes to set the frosting. Slice, serve, and enjoy a moist, rich chocolate cake perfect for 8 guests."
}
